name: Givelight Foundation
mission: Givelight Foundations primary exempt purpose is to provide shelter, clothing and food to children who have been orphaned by a natural disaster or other global crisis; to provide educational, spiritual and social services to the children residing in these orphanages.
theoryOfChange: Givelight Foundation has a published 'Our Model' page that outlines their strategic approach to establishing and running orphanages globally. This document details a step-by-step process, including researching credible organizations, securing donated land, selecting qualified staff, and providing long-term care and education. The model emphasizes a need-based approach focused on the children's long-term well-being, education, and development to help them reach their full potential.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://givelight.org/zakat (Source: https://givelight.org/zakat)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Humanitarian service (+2)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 40/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, education global cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Publish a time-bound plan to deploy excess unrestricted reserves into mission delivery, while keeping a clear operating reserve floor.
components.name: Financial Health

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: GiveLight Foundation shows strong alignment and good impact, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://givelight.org/zakat (Source: https://givelight.org/zakat)

all_citations.claim: The charity holds a 94.66666666666667/100 score and operates programs in Indonesia and other regions.
The organization is zakat-eligible and maintains a specific zakat policy for donors.
Total revenue was $2,186,834 with a program expense ratio of 88.7% and 135.0 months of working capital.
The organization offers various donation options to support its global orphanages.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a 68/100 GMG score due to its high financial efficiency and strong alignment with donor values, though its overall impact score is tempered by the high cost per beneficiary.
areas_for_improvement: Enhance impact reporting to improve the directness and cost-per-beneficiary transparency.
Increase data confidence through more frequent third-party impact evaluations.

dimension_explanations.alignment: The foundation shows high alignment (40/50) for donors interested in global education and orphan care, specifically within a Muslim context as a zakat-eligible entity [2]. Its long-standing presence in crisis zones like Noordeen, Indonesia, highlights a proven track record in addressing urgent global needs [1][4].
dimension_explanations.impact: GiveLight demonstrates strong financial health with a Charity Navigator score of 94.66666666666667/100 and a program expense ratio of 88.7% [1]. While the organization provides direct provision of care, the impact score of 29/50 reflects a relatively high cost per beneficiary of 1377.806 and a need for more comprehensive evidence of long-term effectiveness [3].

baseline_narrative.headline: GiveLight Foundation provides a global safety net for orphans by building permanent homes and families in response to natural disasters and extreme poverty.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 88.7%, ensuring the vast majority of funds reach beneficiaries.
Exceptional fundraising efficiency with a cost of $0.00 per $1 raised.
Robust financial stability with 135.0 months of working capital.
baseline_narrative.summary: The GiveLight Foundation is a crisis relief organization that establishes long-term housing and educational support for orphaned children in regions including Indonesia, Sri Lanka, and Bangladesh [1][3]. The organization is recognized as zakat-eligible, allowing Muslim donors to fulfill their religious obligations through dedicated orphan care programs [2].

confidence.notes: Strong financial data but governance and reserve management impact the overall score.

alignment.explanation: Strong fit for Muslim donors with <cite id="6">verified zakat eligibility</cite> across <cite id="16">eight asnaf categories</cite>.
alignment.improvement: Expand services to <cite id="5">additional underserved geographies</cite> with limited nonprofit coverage.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust GiveLight due to its <cite id="11">4-star rating</cite> and <cite id="14">22-year track record</cite> since its founding in 2004.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the charity should <cite id="13">expand its board size</cite> beyond the current four members to enhance oversight.

impact.explanation: Operations are highly efficient with a <cite id="4">100.0% program ratio</cite>, though the <cite id="15">cost per beneficiary is approximately $1,377.81</cite>.
impact.improvement: The charity should <cite id="9">publish a time-bound plan to deploy excess unrestricted reserves</cite> into mission delivery.

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Partners with local entities for orphanage management and construction

rich_narrative.headline: GiveLight Foundation provides a global safety net for orphans by building permanent homes and families in response to natural disasters and extreme poverty.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to fulfill their zakat through a highly efficient, established organization focused on long-term orphan care and infrastructure.
donor_motivations: Want to ensure 88.7% of their donation reaches program services
Value long-term stability and permanent housing for orphans
Seek to fulfill zakat across multiple eligible categories
Prefer organizations with a long, 20+ year track record
giving_considerations: The organization holds very high reserves, meaning your gift contributes to a very stable endowment-like structure
Focus is on permanent infrastructure rather than rapid emergency response
Small board size may be a concern for donors prioritizing institutional governance
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking to fund organizations that spend their entire budget annually without building large reserves.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects verified outcomes and a strong theory of change, though large-scale independent RCTs are not present.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: GiveLight builds permanent homes and provides education to create a stable family environment that breaks the cycle of poverty for orphans.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that building homes leads to long-term educational and social success for children.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: While reserves are high, the global need for orphan housing in crisis zones remains vast.

organizational_capacity.geographic_reach: Indonesia, Bangladesh, Cambodia, Sri Lanka, Morocco, Pakistan

strengths.detail: The organization maintains a <cite id="4">88.7% program expense ratio</cite> and a fundraising efficiency of <cite id="8">$0.00 per $1 raised</cite>.
GiveLight holds <cite id="9">135.0 months of working capital</cite>, providing an extraordinary buffer for sustained operations during economic downturns.
The charity earned a <cite id="10">perfect 100/100 Leadership & Adaptability score</cite> from Charity Navigator.

strengths_deep_dive: GiveLight Foundation's financial model is characterized by extreme leaness, reporting <cite id="3">$2,186,834 in revenue</cite> while keeping administrative costs at a minimum. This is reflected in their <cite id="11">4-star rating from Charity Navigator</cite>, which highlights their commitment to accountability and transparency. Furthermore, the organization has a <cite id="12">documented theory of change</cite> and has been recognized with the P&G Humanitarian Award for its impact on orphan care globally.
rich_narrative.summary: founded in 2004, GiveLight Foundation is a dedicated crisis relief organization that provides a global safety net for orphans by <cite id="1">building permanent homes and families</cite> in response to natural disasters and extreme poverty. The organization operates with a high degree of financial efficiency, maintaining an <cite id="2">overall score of 94.94.66666666666667/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>. With <cite id="3">$2,186,834 in total revenue</cite> reported in 2023, GiveLight manages a lean operation where <cite id="4">88.7% of expenses are directed toward programs</cite>, ensuring that donor contributions are utilized for direct service delivery. Their reach extends across multiple countries, including <cite id="5">Indonesia, Bangladesh, Cambodia, Sri Lanka, Morocco, and Pakistan</cite>, where they focus on orphanage construction, education support, and sponsorship programs. The charity is <cite id="6">verified as zakat-eligible</cite>, serving eight specific asnaf categories including the poor (fuqara) and needy (masakin). By prioritizing long-term stability over temporary relief, GiveLight ensures that children in crisis zones receive <cite id="7">housing, education, and emotional support</cite> until they reach adulthood.
